heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 9.4°C) and outside temperature (down 7.6°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 8952 lux), cloud levels (up 414 m), and pressure (down 6 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 13797 lux) and cloud levels (up 1278 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 414.0m lower than yesterday, 489.5m lower than the past week, 1278.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 1181m and a high of 2400m, averaging 1184.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

dew point temperature.description:
Today’s average dew point temperature is 6.3°C lower than yesterday, 3.8°C lower than the past week, 3.6°C lower than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 12.5°C minimum and 18.2°C maximum, with an average of 8.8°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 12.6°C and 12.4°C.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
